qas.question: The present Mediterranean Sea descends from what sea?
What period opened the Tethys Ocean?
What period did plates reverse directions to compress the Tethys floor?
Microplates squeezing and rotating created the features of what?
What period closed up the Tethys Ocean?
During what period was southern Europe discovered?
When did the Jurassic Period end?
During what period was the Tethys floor discovered?
Between which years did the Mediterranean Sea flow into the Tethys sea?

context: In southern Europe, the stage was set in the <a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>Triassic Period<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/> of the <a1_0><b5_0>Mesozoic Era<b5_0/><a1_0/>, with the opening of the Tethys Ocean, between the Eurasian and African tectonic plates, between about <b9_0>240 MBP and 220 MBP<b9_0/> (million years before present). The present Mediterranean Sea descends from this somewhat larger <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>Tethys<a0_1/> sea<a0_2/><a0_0/>. At about <b7_0>180 MBP<b7_0/>, in the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b8_0>Jurassic Period<b8_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, the two plates reversed direction and began to compress the Tethys floor, causing it to be subducted under Eurasia and pushing up the edge of the latter plate in the Alpine Orogeny of the Oligocene and Miocene Periods. Several microplates were caught in the squeeze and rotated or were pushed laterally, generating the individual features of <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>Mediterranean geography<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>: <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>Iberia<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> pushed up the Pyrenees; Italy, the Alps, and Anatolia, moving west, the mountains of Greece and the islands. The compression and orogeny continue today, as shown by the ongoing raising of the mountains a small amount each year and the active volcanoes.
